hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility dropping below 40% (current 30-day high) and 7-day ATR compression to <2.5% of price, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound on >1.5x average volume signals a transition to BULL regime with 5% follow-through within 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with collapsing volatility often precede directional regime shifts. Compression periods resolve explosively in crypto, with volume-confirmed Bollinger breaks providing high-probability momentum signals before full regime transition confirmation.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 40% of its 30-day high
BTC closes >20-day Bollinger Band upper bound (2 std)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain >2 days or results in immediate reversal below band without 5% move.
